title: Civics at Work: Constitution Day Training for Federal Employees
description: To face today’s challenges, the federal government must recognize the national security imperative of reinvigorating civic education, and that starts with reinvigorating its own civics programs this Constitution Day.

title: Is Latin America Important to China’s Foreign Policy?
description: Ryan C. Berg and Thiago de Aragão assess the strategic importance of Latin America for Chinese foreign policy strategy and offer solutions for the United States to test China’s commitment in the region.

title: What Lies Ahead for the U.S.-ROK Alliance? A Conversation with Reps. Ami Bera and Young Kim
description: Please join us for a special discussion on the U.S.-ROK alliance with Representatives Ami Bera (D-CA) and Young Kim (R-CA).

title: Anti-corruption as a National Security Priority: Planning the Development Response
description: Foreign assistance is a critical part of addressing corruption in the developing world but requires a thoughtful approach to ensure success.

title: Tunisia – What Now?
description: Join the CSIS Project on Prosperity and Development, Middle East Program, and Human Rights Initiative for a conversation on the surprising developments in Tunisia over the past month and a look at what the future holds for the country.

title: Foreign Purchases of U.S. Agricultural Land: Facts, Figures, and an Assessment of Real Threats
description: Foreign ownership of U.S. agricultural land has doubled over the past decade, and many policymakers are concerned. Even so, who controls the future of U.S. farmland is a larger issue that cannot be addressed through narrow policy solutions.

title: Guinea: The Causes and Consequences of West Africa’s Latest Coup
description: What led to the recent military coup in Guinea? Judd Devermont explores the coup's implications and how the international community can help prevent further democratic backsliding in West Africa.

title: A Mission to Mars: A Conversation with Her Excellency Sarah Al Amiri, UAE Minister of State for Advanced Technology
description: Please join CSIS for a Smart Women, Smart Power conversation with Her Excellency Sarah bint Yousef Al Amiri, the UAE minister of state for advanced technology and chairwoman of the UAE Space Agency.

title: Examining Extremism: Islamic State Khorasan Province (ISKP)
description: The Transnational Threats Project’s Examining Extremism series provides an overview and assessment of Islamic State Khorasan Province — a regional affiliate of the Islamic State operating in Central and South Asia.

title: Sinpo South Shipyard Update
description: Thirteen satellite images of the Sinpo South Shipyard and its environs collected between April 21 and September 1, 2021, provide an opportunity to update the status of the facility.

title: Future NATO Enlargement: Force Requirements and Budget Costs
description: Past NATO enlargement helped produce a Europe whole, free, and at peace, but future enlargement, facing a hostile Russia, could require billions of dollars in additional defense spending. NATO and the United States should weigh these costs in future enlargement decisions.

title: Speaking Different Languages
description: In this week’s column, the Scholl Chair looks at the disconnect between trade traditionalists and activists and argues that trade agreements should be about trade.
